name: postmark
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
an official mark put on a letter or parcel, typically showing the place that it was sent from and the time or date that it was sent

to put a postmark on a letter or parcel: Almost all of the letters were postmarked in Florida. Voter registration forms had to be postmarked by midnight.
More examplesFewer examplesHe talked his way to the front of a line at the post office to have his envelope postmarked before noon.The forms must be delivered or postmarked by 5.00 p.m. Monday.The letter was postmarked September 18.

an official mark on letters or packages, showing the place and day, month, and year of mailing postmark verb [ T ] us
Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio
/ˈpoʊstˌmɑrk/
Contest entries must be postmarked no later than July 16.
Add to word list
Add to word list
an official mark put on a letter or package, showing the place that it was sent from and the time or date that it was sent: Twenty-four letters were delivered with a Washington D.C. postmark.
to put an official mark on a letter or package, showing the place that it was sent from and the time or date that it was sent: be postmarked Applications must be postmarked by Oct. 1.
